title: No, Your Peloton Instructor Isn’t Getting Laid Off
sub_head: Fitness instructors, often social-media famous and viewed as brand ambassadors, elude company cutbacks
body:
Peloton Interactive Inc . ’s fitness instructors won’t face layoffs amid the company’s recent cutbacks as the exercise-equipment maker spared its brand ambassadors.
The company said Tuesday it was cutting 2,800 corporate jobs in response to falling demand and growing losses. Peloton co-founder John Foley is also stepping down as chief executive and will become executive chairman, the company said. He is being replaced by Barry McCarthy, the former chief financial officer of Spotify Technology SA and Netflix Inc.
